author: {'steamid': '76561198021551803', 'num_games_owned': 5281, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1611661555}
review:
[i]No hallelujah's here[/i]

[h1]Review[/h1]
Before Blooper went off on a horror tangent with [b]The Medium[/b], [b]Blair Witch[/b] and the [b]Layers of Fear[/b] series, they made a puzzle platformer called [b]A-Men[/b] which introduced us to a whole host of forgettable characters that delighted in sprouting cringe-worthy dialog that mostly elicited a moan or rollback of the eyes. How and why the original managed to get a sequel is beyond me as I can't imagine it was a massive success given it's "49% mixed reception" here on Steam, but here we are with pretty much the same formula as the original. Nothing has changed except for the difficulty, which seems to have been ramped up from the original. 

I wouldn't necessarily purchase it unless you get it in a bundle as the puzzles aren't all that exciting to solve and it feels like a chore to move through the game, especially since the same cast of generic characters reappear and add nothing new. It's nice to see Blooper's trajectory though. Going from the mobile-looking [b]A-Men[/b] to [b]The Medium[/b] is impressive indeed. I am giving [b]A-Men 2[/b] a thumbs up because there is no neutral option and I always prefer to ere on the side of positivity with these neutral games.

[h1]One word or phrase to sum up the experience[/h1]
[i]Generic[/i]

[h1]Performance/Bug related incidents[/h1]
[i]None[/i]

[h1]Similar to games[/h1]
[i][b]Toki-Tori 2[/b], [b]Mousecraft[/b], [b]Worms[/b][/i]

[h1]Rating ★★★★★☆☆☆☆☆[/h1]
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=869454819

review: A-Men 2 is the most fun puzzle game i've played in a looooong time, that being said it's tough. If you are horrible at puzzles don't play this game, however if you are at least good at puzzles then I recommend it. It mixes normal puzzle mechanics with commenly known personalities for characters. Game is pretty great and if they ever release a third, I'd play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157198557', 'num_games_owned': 5894, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1507094085}
review:
A-Men 2 ist ein sehr bunter 2D Plattformer der wirklich Spaß macht.

+ sehr bunt...gutes Leveldesign
+ viele verschiedene Charaktere
+ viele taktische Möglichkeiten...die man auch nutzen muss

- Steuerung ist sehr sensibel

Das Spiel ist eine gelungene Fortsetzung des ersten Teils und der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist von Anfang an gleich recht hoch.
Das Spiel macht genau da weiter wo der erste Teil aufghört hat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006563527', 'num_games_owned': 3471, 'num_reviews': 909, 'playtime_forever': 655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1564740289}
review:
A-Men 2 ist ein buntes 2D-Plattform-Actionspiel mit starkem Rätselelementen. Wie sein Vorgänger steuern wir ein Team von unterschiedlichen Charakteren mit unterschiedlichen Fähigkeiten die eine überlegenen Anzahl Gegner überwinden muss. Wir haben allerdings zu wenig Munition um sie direkt zu massakrieren, also müssen wir sie zermatschen, sprengen, in Löcher fallen lassen. Das ist schon anspruchsvoll, durch das interessante Leveldesign, direkt schwieriger von Beginn an als Teil1 , also wirklich eine Fortsetzung ist. Was mich enorm frustriert hat, ist die überempfindliche Steuerung. Generell funktioniert es aber ordentlich und erinnert mich vage an die Commandos-Reihe, nur eben in sehr bunt, in 2D und ohne Nazis. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O5XzYAV-q4Y

review:
[h1][b]Análisis Inicial (~5.1/10.0)[/b][/h1]

Comencemos … este es un Juego ... Bueno, por esta razón te sugiero que ... Agrégalo, ¡¡¡ pero con descuento. !!! o ponlo en la lista de deseados una temporada.

Espera , léelo todo antes de hacer lo que estás pensando. pues respecto al precio [b]Muy costoso.[/b] y tu tiempo en la silla será Decente.

Tuve algunos problemas menores con los personajes atascados y el motor de física extraño

Tienes a 5 personajes diferentes, todos con sus propias habilidades. Recolecta cosas y mata a los enemigos y no olvides resolver los acertijos. Cada etapa contenía un conjunto de mini objetivos no tan difíciles. 

Hablando de opciones, mientras disfrutaba de las bromas entre los personajes, el juego también proporcionaba la opción de desactivar y silenciar las conversaciones si eso te molestaba.

Bonito estilo artístico, excelente banda sonora, humor decente y 40 niveles extraños para dominar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 860, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 860, 'last_played': 1495655492}
review:
Tags: Casual - Lemmings & Snake
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: This is more of a collection of extra maps for A-Men than a sequel and as a result suffers from the same problems

Outstanding Issues with Game : Controls are way too clunky, requires too much precise timing across different Z levels, does not allow you to keep visual track of those multiple Z levels while you try to implement your solution, no instant retry for sections you fail, no restart button easily accessible for the whole level, happy go lucky dumb universe is grating, sound design is not great, visually starting to age badly.

The good : Conceptually a reverse lemming where you gotta kill them all is a lot more entertaining than the original - save every single one.

Conclusion : Execution falls too hard and fast on the concept and breaks it into bits of frustration and disappointment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124770841', 'num_games_owned': 2744, 'num_reviews': 555, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1451881491}
review:
这游戏没有存在2代的意义，我对二代地看法同我对一代的看法。
以下是我对一代的评论：
”有够傻的一个游戏。
廉价的过场动画，我好歹认为有点有趣吧。。。
尤其是操作，其实游戏本身看起来还是有点意思，完全被游戏反人类的操作给毁了。
明明用鼠标瞄准方向，为什么开枪要弄成E键？
也许这样是怕误开枪浪费子弹。因为游戏中开枪貌似主要用于解谜，有子弹限制。
但是稍微考虑一下正常人的操作行不行？正常人有移动鼠标的操作就会有下意识点击鼠标的操作啊。如此一来丢弃人们连贯的操作而瞎操不必要的心是否有本末倒置的嫌疑？
最后，这脑残游戏得挂6小时才掉卡。本身又难玩，只能挂卡，结果又是那种打开了就不好切出去的逗比游戏（窗口总会自己跑到最前），而且，游戏明明有窗口化，结果每次点击就会游戏卡死崩溃。神他么不能愉快挂卡的游戏。
PS.这游戏还有二代，没有任何改进，可以算是一代的增加关卡，连同上述的一切毛病也一并存在。制作商吃屎了，发行商也跟着吃屎了。“
最后，不知道会不会出三代，出了说明这坨屎虽然有毒但是挺香的？制作商和发行商吃个不停。

author: {'steamid': '76561198029139401', 'num_games_owned': 1921, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1454958431}
review:
The keyboard controls are so unintuitive that I keep confusing three different things several missions in. Considering there are lots of situations requiring fast reactions, this makes the game largely unplayable and frustrating. :-(

At the very least, try turning on the "Alternate interface assistance", which makes the controls a bit less left-hand heavy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987558637', 'num_games_owned': 3403, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1448223450}
review:
Imagina un título que de primeras puede parecer atractivo, donde tienes multitud de personajes con características definidas y con un proposito para superar un nivel en concreto.
Puzzles, acción y destreza.  Una formula que le podría marcar como uno de esos juegos que llegan a tus manos y hasta que no lo terminas no paras... sino fuera porque es una completo y desafortando truño poco digno de gastarse incluso los centimos que pueda costar.  Personajes sin gracia sobre escenarios sin gracia, con limitaciones estúpidas y un control te hará pensar que golpearte el dedo pequeño del pie con el sofa, es mucho más divertido.
Sin duda, salvo que quieras posturear irracionalmente de algo que no le gusta ni al que lo ha hecho, este no es tu título.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996152700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1510097309}
review:
EDIT: I found solution to launch game on some guide(link below) for first game, and it worked for both. You have to run "regedit" app. Then find game in "Computer\HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Blooberteam\", click on game you want to fix, on right side you will see some DWORD values. "width" and "height" will be amongst them. Open them to edit, switch to "Decimal" and enter your resolution width and height, then close Regedit. also under Windows 10 you may need to find game EXE file and through its properties turn off DPI scaling.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=807799664

author: {'steamid': '76561198059561891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 416, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1438063335}
review:
Back in February, 2014, I had the pleasure of checking out a interesting little indie puzzle/platformer game called A-men. The game had some interesting mechanics that involved puzzle solving all the while sneaking/murdering and platforming. In the game you played five different classes with unique abilites that all had something to help you solve the puzzle of that level. The enemies were simple automatons and the game boasted quite a few levels. Now here in 2015, A-men 2 brings you almost exactly the same thing.
The best part of A-men 2 is that it seems to have trimmed the fat and gotten its core-mechanics front and forward.

The game is simple, kill X number of baddies using traps littered around the level or class abilities in an effort to get the helicopter to come down and pick up your men. Your troops are rather squishy so keen judgement, timing and decent platforming are required. This stands pretty much exactly the way it did in the first game. The difference being that you have access to the other classes immediately and get into the nitty gritty of things rather quickly.  The controls have been tightened up a bit and everything seems to flow a bit better in this game.

The graphics also haven't really changed that much either, the tone, abilities, soundtrack, and menus, it all more or less is the same. That isn't necessarily a bad thing, but it should be noted that for a sequel there really isn't much as far as new features go. Oddly enough though, it does look like they threw any semblance of story away in this game. A-men 2 mostly feels like an expansion instead of sequel, however if you were a fan of the first one this is a great thing. You've got even more levels, shopping, and medals to collect.

More Stuff? Great! This is all well and good but some of the same problems that A-men had transfer over from the first. Mostly the game is rather monotone. The game is slow paced as you must plan every move very delicately. It also sadly doesn't really excite me as a game but then again it is a puzzle game, thinking is more important then anything flashy. A-men also boasts being a very extremely difficult game, while this may frustrate some, other may enjoy this. One thing stands true, you are going to repeat content quite a bit. There are in game save booths around some levels that decrease this, but at a penalty of score. So if you want to get the best score you can, you have to do it from beginning to end in one shot. This can be slightly frustrating, but not game breaking, as this is a more challenge you put on yourself. That being said, you will die constantly, even from slightly brushing the enemy.

That isn't to say A-men 2 cheats you. Most of the time if you die, it was you who screwed up. The levels designs are done quite cleverly, as you turn the traps and area against the enemy. From buzzsaws, boulders, and good ol' grenades, there are many destructive options. Aside from the base missions you also have quite a few mini-objectives that can keep you entertained and add an extra level of challenge and plenty of replay value.

At the end of the day, there isn't anything really all that wrong with A-men 2, it's a unique take on the puzzle platformer and things have gotten more smooth as far as the gameplay goes. The only thing I really wanted to see was something new. A new class or, hell, even splitscreen would've made this worth calling a sequel. But as it stands, this is just a very nice expansion to the first game. Which if you are a fan, you will enjoy. At a buck cheaper then the first, you might enjoy this a bit more. If you are sitting on the fence, I would suggest probably watching videos on the first game and making a decision from there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985036092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 292, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1437281461}
review:
[i]Disclaimer: Steam code provided by developer[/i]
A-Men 2 hasn't changed the formula. What it has done is tighten the controls and entire presentation up. Did have a few minor issues with characters getting stuck and the physics engine behaving strangely but it's a remarkable improvement from the original and not only challenging but quite rewarding once you master all the unique abilities.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CN2K7ruMeCY
Gameplay is very similar to [b]The Lost Vikings[/b].  Introduced to 5 different characters all having their own skills and upgrade paths. Required to clear each level by collecting resources, killing enemies and solving the puzzles. Each stage contained a bunch of reasonably difficult mini objectives so the re-playability is there once you finish off the primary tasks. Completing levels rewards a total score along with gold coins which can be used further enhance your characters or just buy them better looking gear, such as pink ninja suits.

Controlled well with both kb+mouse and gamepad, preferred a pad but included were precision targeting options which was a nice touch. Speaking of options, while I enjoyed the banter between characters the game also provided the option to disable and mute chatter if it bothers you. Unfortunately keys could not be rebound but the default setup was intutive enough. Do feel there was a missed opportunity to add local co-op support but perhaps we'll see that in A-Men 3.

Lovely artstyle, great soundtrack, decent humour and 40 odd levels to master means A-Men 2 offers a fair bit of value for the price point. Would advise it's not for the casual minded puzzle fans but if you're up for a challenge and feel like stretching the old brains cells a bit I can recommend checking it out. Cheers folks :)
